panels.content:
# Microbenchmarks

The charts below display each microbenchmark's throughput data.
The data consists of the throughput measured for the nightly microbenchmark execution, the average
microbenchmark throughput for the last 30 days (based on 30 days of existing Jenkins artifacts),
the minimum tolerable throughput as set manually, and the minimum tolerable throughput as set by
2 * the standard deviation of throughput over the last 30 days (based on Jenkins artifacts). Alerts
will be sent to slack if a microbenchmark's execution falls below either of the minimum tolerances
for two microbenchmark runs (it is not specific per test so if test A violates the tolerance day 1 and
test B violates the tolerance day 2 an alert will be sent). If new microbenchmark tests are added to
the repository they will automatically show up in the dashboard.
panels.title: Description

alert.message:
One of the microbenchmarks has dropped below the allowed throughput degradation. Sorry, we cannot provide more details about which but you can find out more at stats.noise.page

- InCRUDibles
alert.name: Microbenchmark alert

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  $__time(time),
  (metrics->>'throughput')::numeric as "throughput",
  (metrics->>'ref_throughput')::numeric as "30 day rolling avg",
  (metrics->>'throughput')::numeric - (2 * (metrics->>'stdev_throughput')::numeric) as "2 stdev below mean",
  (metrics->>'ref_throughput')::numeric * (metrics->>'tolerance')::numeric / 100 as "manual tolerance",
  -- Following are just for alerting purposes and should be hidden
  ((metrics->>'throughput')::numeric - (metrics->>'ref_throughput')::numeric + 2 * (metrics->>'stdev_throughput')::numeric) / (metrics->>'ref_throughput')::numeric * 100 as "2stdev tolerance leeway",
  ((metrics->>'throughput')::numeric - (metrics->>'ref_throughput')::numeric) / (metrics->>'ref_throughput')::numeric + (metrics->>'tolerance')::numeric as "manual tolerance leeway" 
FROM
  microbenchmark_results
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(time) AND
  POSITION(benchmark_suite in ${benchmark_test} ) = 1 AND
  ${benchmark_test} LIKE CONCAT('%',benchmark_name) AND
  git_branch = 'origin/master' AND
  wal_device = 'RAM disk'

SELECT
  $__time(time),
  (metrics->>'throughput')::numeric as "throughput",
  (metrics->>'ref_throughput')::numeric as "30 day rolling avg",
  (metrics->>'throughput')::numeric - (2 * (metrics->>'stdev_throughput')::numeric) as "2 stdev below mean",

  -- Following are just for alerting purposes and should be hidden
  ((metrics->>'throughput')::numeric - (metrics->>'ref_throughput')::numeric + 2 * (metrics->>'stdev_throughput')::numeric) / (metrics->>'ref_throughput')::numeric * 100 as "2stdev tolerance leeway",
  ((metrics->>'throughput')::numeric - (metrics->>'ref_throughput')::numeric) / (metrics->>'ref_throughput')::numeric + (metrics->>'tolerance')::numeric as "manual tolerance leeway" 
FROM
  microbenchmark_results
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(time) AND
  POSITION(benchmark_suite in ${benchmark_test} ) = 1 AND
  ${benchmark_test} LIKE CONCAT('%',benchmark_name) AND
  git_branch = 'origin/master' AND
  wal_device = 'RAM disk'

SELECT
  $__time(time),
  (metrics->>'throughput')::numeric as "throughput",
  (metrics->>'ref_throughput')::numeric as "30 day rolling avg",
  (metrics->>'throughput')::numeric - (2 * (metrics->>'stdev_throughput')::numeric) as "2 stdev below mean",

  ((metrics->>'throughput')::numeric - (metrics->>'ref_throughput')::numeric + 2 * (metrics->>'stdev_throughput')::numeric) / (metrics->>'ref_throughput')::numeric * 100 as "2stdev tolerance leeway",
  ((metrics->>'throughput')::numeric - (metrics->>'ref_throughput')::numeric) / (metrics->>'ref_throughput')::numeric + (metrics->>'tolerance')::numeric as "manual tolerance leeway" 
FROM
  microbenchmark_results
WHERE
  $__timeFilter(time) AND
  POSITION(benchmark_suite in ${benchmark_test} ) = 1 AND

  git_branch = 'origin/master' AND
